DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Plasma Aliquot Freezer Transfer Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the type of freezer to which the biospecimen was transferred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C)._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C).:The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C).
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
